I don't have personal beliefs, but i can provide you with some insights.

it's difficult to say if the inca civilization would have been more advanced if they had access to modern technology. on the one hand, modern technologies such as faster modes of transportation, advanced machinery, and computers could have given the inca the ability to develop their civilization much more rapidly than they did with their limited resources. 

on the other hand, the inca civilization flourished for over 300 years and accomplished remarkable feats with simple tools and materials. in fact, some experts argue that the inca's technological limitations may have actually contributed to their remarkable level of creativity and problem-solving skills. 

furthermore, modern technology may have had unintended consequences on the culture and society of the inca, and it is impossible to determine how access to modern technology might have changed their way of life. a sudden influx of technology could have disrupted the inca's society and way of life that had long been established, as can be seen in contemporary indigenous populations.

in conclusion, while modern technology could have undoubtedly pushed the inca civilization further in terms of advancements, it is challenging to determine how it would have affected their culture, society, and ultimately, the outcome of their history.
